description: Here’s the Scoop: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s death, online rhetoric has become a divisive topic. NBC News’ David Ingram explains how online behavior affects what happens offline. Listen to today’s full episode of “Here’s the Scoop,” hosted by Yasmin Vossoughian, wherever you get your podcasts.
title: How growing rhetoric online impacts the world offline

description: Tyler Robinson appeared in a Utah County courtroom via video link for the first time after being arrested on suspicion of fatally shooting Charlie Kirk, sitting emotionless as the judge read the charges against him and only speaking when asked to state his name.
title: Kirk shooting suspect appears in court

description: Bondi says Justice Dept. will target hate speech users
title: Bondi says Justice Dept. will target hate speech users

description: Utah officials remind public that the Charlie Kirk shooting suspect will be judged in a court of law and "not the court of public opinion."
title: Utah officials offer reminder to public

author: Pilar Melendez
description: Vivian Wilson, Elon Musk's estranged daughter, talks about her first fashion week and why she loves 'inherently political' runway shows.
title: Vivian Wilson, Elon Musk's estranged daughter, makes her New York Fashion Week debut

description: Utah County attorney Jeff Gray recounts what the parents of Tyler Robinson told police about the suspected Charlie Kirk shooter and how they recognized him in a surveillance picture.
title: Robinson’s parents recall recognizing him in manhunt photo

description: FBI director Kash Patel says his post on X stating “the subject” in the shooting of Charlie Kirk was in custody was not a mistake, even though he could “have been more careful” in his choice of words. The subject mentioned in that post was ultimately not the suspect the FBI arrested for the shooting.
title: Patel defends post about Charlie Kirk ‘subject’

description: Utah officials release a text exchange between the Charlie Kirk suspect and his roommate in the moments after the shooting.
title: Texts between Charlie Kirk suspect & roommate released

description: Utah County Attorney Jeff Gray announced 22-year-old Tyler Robinson is charged with aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm causing serious bodily injury and obstruction of justice in connection with the shooting death of Charlie Kirk.
title: Charges announced in shooting death of Charlie Kirk

description: Schiff and Patel get into shouting match at hearing
title: Schiff and Patel get into shouting match at hearing

description: Prosecutors in Utah will seek the death penalty for the suspect in Charlie Kirk’s assassination.
title: Officials seek death penalty for Charlie Kirk shooter

description: Scientists find world's oldest mummies
title: Scientists find world's oldest mummies

description: Sen. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., and FBI Director Kash Patel got into a shouting match as the senator asked about Ghislaine Maxwell being moved to a lower security prison. Patel called Schiff a "liar" and "political buffoon" before the hearing was brought back into order.
title: Patel calls Schiff a 'liar' and 'political buffoon' at Senate hearing

author: Denise Chow
description: A melting glacier in southeastern Alaska has birthed a brand-new island in the middle of a growing lake, according to recent images captured by NASA satellites
title: Melting glacier creates a new island in Alaska, satellite images show

description: ‘Ghost ship’ missing since 1886 found in Lake Michigan
title: ‘Ghost ship’ missing since 1886 found in Lake Michigan

description: Stanley Tucci joins NBC Winter Olympics broadcast team
title: Stanley Tucci joins NBC Winter Olympics broadcast team

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi said the Trump administration will be "targeting" hate speech, which she differentiated from free speech — and then tried to walk back a day later.
title: Attorney General Pam Bondi says DOJ will be 'targeting' people who use 'hate speech'

author: Aria Bendix
description: A childhood vaccine showdown between West Virginia's Republican governor and school board could be settled by two competing lawsuits.
title: In West Virginia, government and school battle over the future of vaccine mandates

description: FBI Director Kash Patel seemingly commits to helping tone down rhetoric blaming sides for political violence, as requested by Sen. Amy Klobuchar in a Senate hearing.
title: Patel commits to help tone down rhetoric blaming sides

description: Sen. Lindsey Graham questioned FBI Director Kash Patel about free speech and social media while he testified over his handling of the investigation into Charlie Kirk's assassination.
title: Sen. Graham presses FBI on social media

author: Rob Wile
description: Consumers increasingly report feeling glum about the economy.
title: The economy is chugging along, but consumers are uneasy

description: Judge drops Luigi Mangione terrorism charges
title: Judge drops Luigi Mangione terrorism charges

description: Robert Redford gets introspective in 1992 interview
title: Robert Redford gets introspective in 1992 interview

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor warned that poor civics education means Americans may not know the difference between a president and a king.
title: Sotomayor questions if Americans know the difference between presidents and kings

description: Ahead of questioning FBI Director Kash Patel over his handling of the investigation into Charlie Kirk's assassination, Democratic Sen. Durbin criticized Patel and called for unity amid a period of political violence, saying, "All of us in public life, on both sides of the aisle have a responsibility to bring down the temperature and to work to unite the American people."
title: Durbin: 'Our political opponents are not our enemies'

description: A New York judge dismissed state terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione, but kept the second-degree murder charges in connection with the December killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. NBC News' Tom Winter reports on what this means for Mangione's trial.
title: State terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione are dismissed

author: David K. Li
description: Three flight attendants suffered minor injuries during a turbulent Delta Air Lines journey from Ecuador to Atlanta, officials said Tuesday
title: Turbulence on Delta Air Lines flight injures 3 flight attendants

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Two young boys accused of causing at least $50,000 in damage at a Florida elementary school library face several charges, including criminal mischief, after their mothers turned them in to authorities.
title: 2 Florida boys accused of $50K in damage at school library are turned in by their moms

author: Rob Wile
description: LimeWire, the filesharing service that set the internet ablaze in the 2000s before being shut down for copyright infringement, said Tuesday that is acquiring the rights to Fyre Festival
title: LimeWire acquires Fyre Festival, asking 'What Could Possibly Go Wrong?'

description: FBI Director Kash Patel testified on Capitol Hill that the father of the suspect in the Charlie Kirk assassination contacted the FBI after identifying him in images released to the public.
title: Kash Patel says Charlie Kirk suspect's father told FBI

author: Adam Reiss
description: A New York state judge on Tuesday dismissed state terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione, but kept second-degree murder charges in connection with the December killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson
title: New York judge dismisses state terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione, keeps murder charge

description: Hollywood legend Robert Redford dead at 89
title: Hollywood legend Robert Redford dead at 89

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz on Tuesday announced that he would seek re-election to a third term in 2026.“I want to make Minnesota a place where everyone has a chance to succeed, in every corner of the state,” Walz said in an announcement video
title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz will run for a third term in 2026

description: Watch live coverage as FBI Director Kash Patel testifies at a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing.
title: FBI Director Patel testifies at Senate hearing

description: Video shows a Russian drone hitting a building in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv.
title: Russian drone hits building in Ukraine's Kharkiv

description: Hollywood legend Robert Redford has died at age 89. Reporting for TODAY, NBC’s Joe Fryer looks back at his life and legacy.
title: Robert Redford Dies at 89: Look Back at His Life in Hollywood

description: Israel begins expanded ground offensive in Gaza City
title: Israel begins expanded ground offensive in Gaza City

description: An independent U.N. inquiry has concluded that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, joining a growing chorus of experts and rights officials in that assessment. Israel dismissed the report as "distorted and false."
title: UN inquiry finds Israel is committing genocide in Gaza

description: The start of a two-day meeting by the Federal Reserve is being closely watched by Wall Street and American consumers with questions about the future of interest rates. NBC’s Christine Romans joins TODAY to break down what to know.
title: Fed to Begin 2-Day Meeting: Will It Change Interest Rates?

author: Christian Orozco
description: Israel launches a ground offensive in Gaza City.
title: White House vows vengeance for Kirk and a grilling awaits Patel: Morning Rundown

author: Andrew Greif
description: Legendary quarterback Tom Brady was announced as the headliner for a new flag football event featuring both active and retired NFL players that will take place March 21, 2026 — in Saudi Arabia.
title: Tom Brady is returning to the field for a flag football tournament in Saudi Arabia

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Former Georgia Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan — who served as a Republican but publicly switched parties to become a Democrat last month — on Tuesday jumped into the race to become Georgia’s next governor.“Georgians deserve leaders with the courage to take on Donald Trump and do what’s right,” Duncan said in a statement announcing his campaign.
title: Former Georgia Republican Geoff Duncan launches a run for governor as a Democrat

author: Andrew Jones
description: Spain became the latest country to threaten to boycott Israel’s continued participation of the Eurovision Song Contest.
title: Spain to quit 2026 Eurovision Song Contest if Israel participates

description: Dozens killed after Israeli airstrike in Gaza City
title: Dozens killed after Israeli airstrike in Gaza City

author: Joe Kottke
description: President Donald Trump on Monday filed a federal defamation lawsuit against the New York Times, four of its reporters and Penguin Random House over coverage of his 2024 campaign
title: Trump files $15 billion lawsuit against New York Times over campaign coverage

author: Freddie Clayton
description: Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians in Gaza, a United Nations commission said Tuesday, calling on the international community to end the campaign and punish the top officials it found responsible for inciting it
title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, U.N. inquiry finds

description: Large explosions seen in Gaza from southern Israel
title: Large explosions seen in Gaza from southern Israel

description: Large explosions were seen overnight in Gaza from southern Israel as the IDF expands its military operation in Gaza City. In a social media post, Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said Gaza was “burning,” adding that Israel will “not relent.”
title: Explosions seen in Gaza overnight from southern Israel

description: South Korea investigating worker treatment during raid
title: South Korea investigating worker treatment during raid

description: Pink dye tracks pollution at California beach
title: Pink dye tracks pollution at California beach

author: Raquel Coronell Uribe
description: Former DNC interim chair Donna Brazile, who was Norton's chief of staff in the 1990s, called on the Democratic delegate to not seek re-election to Congress in 2026.
title: D.C. Del. Eleanor Holmes Norton, age 88, faces a high-profile call to retire

description: Some employers firing people for posts on Charlie Kirk
title: Some employers firing people for posts on Charlie Kirk

description: Appeals court blocks Trump from removing Lisa Cook
title: Appeals court blocks Trump from removing Lisa Cook

description: New details released about Colorado school shooter
title: New details released about Colorado school shooter

author: Dennis Romero
description: Television star Nick Cannon, known for having 12 children with six women, said Monday that having so many kids was "careless" without his having worked through his own trauma first
title: Nick Cannon says having 12 kids was 'careless' without confronting trauma first

author: Zoë Richards
description: Trump indicated that Chicago was next on his list, which now includes St. Louis as a possible target for federal intervention.
title: Trump signs order to send National Guard to Memphis for crime crackdown

author: Sahil Kapur
description: A standoff over how to prevent a government shutdown intensified as President Donald Trump called on Republicans to write a funding bill on their own.
title: Trump tells GOP to cut Democrats out of funding bill as Schumer warns of shutdown

author: Steve Kopack
description: A panel of federal judges blocked President Donald Trump from removing Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve's board, hours before she and other top Fed officials are set to begin a meeting on whether to lower interest rates
title: Appeals court blocks Trump from removing Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve board before interest rate meeting

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Miran currently serves as the chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers. He will fill the remainder of a former governor's term, which is set to end in January.
title: Senate confirms Trump nominee Stephen Miran to the Federal Reserve
